* Represents a Deadline task, which is a specific type of Task.
* A Deadline task has a description and a deadline (stored in the {@code by} field).
* This class extends the {@link Task} class and overrides the {@code toString()}
* method to provide a custom string representation of the task, including the deadline.
* The description and deadline are extracted from the input command string.
* The description is the part of the command before the "/by" keyword, and the deadline
* is the part after the "/by" keyword.
* Deadline deadline = new Deadline("deadline Submit report /by 2023-10-31");
* Overrides toString() method to print custom String
* @return String containing status, Deadline Task type, description and deadline
* Represents an Event task, which is a specific type of Task.
* An Event task has a description, a start time (stored in the {@code from} field),
* and an end time (stored in the {@code to} field).
* This class extends the {@link Task} class and overrides the {@code toString()}
* method to provide a custom string representation of the task, including the start and end times.
* The description, start time, and end time are extracted from the input command string.
* The description is the part of the command before the "/from" keyword, the start time
* is the part between the "/from" and "/to" keywords, and the end time is the part after
* Event event = new Event("event Team meeting /from 2023-10-31 2pm /to 2023-10-31 4pm");
* System.out.println(event); // Outputs: "[ ] Event: Team meeting (from 2023-10-31 2pm to 2023-10-31 4pm)"
* Overrides toString() method to print custom String
* @return String with status, Event Task type, description and start and end date
return String.format("[%s] Event: %s (from %s to %s)", getStatusIcon(), description,

* @return "X" if Task has been marked as completed, " " otherwise

* Parses a given date string into a {@link LocalDateTime} object based on various supported date formats.
* If the date string does not include a time component, the provided {@link LocalTime} defaultTime is used
* @param dateStr     The date string to parse.
* @param defaultTime The default time to use if the date string does not include a time component.
* @return A {@link LocalDateTime} object representing the parsed date and time or null if the format is
public LocalDateTime parseDate(String dateStr, LocalTime defaultTime) {
return LocalDateTime.parse(dateStr, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy HH:mm:ss"));
return LocalDateTime.parse(dateStr, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy HH:mm"));
LocalDate date = LocalDate.parse(dateStr, DateTimeFormatter.ofPattern("dd MMM yyyy"));
* Represents a Todo task, which is a specific type of Task.
* A Todo task has a description but no additional date or time constraints.
* This class extends the {@link Task} class and overrides the {@code toString()}
* method to provide a custom string representation of the task.
* The description of the Todo task is extracted from the input command string
* and stored in the {@code description} field inherited from the {@link Task} class.
* Todo todo = new Todo("todo Buy groceries");
* Overrides toString() method to print custom String
* @return String containing status, Todo task type and description
